meanings.definition: A deep, loud roar typically made by a bull or large animal.
meanings.sent1: The bellow of the lion echoed through the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The bull let out a powerful bellow in the field.
meanings.sent3: The bellow of the elephant startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The bellow of the storm clouds warned of an approaching downpour.
meanings.sent5: The bellow of the waterfall could be heard from afar.

meanings.sent1: He would bellow for attention whenever he entered the room.
meanings.sent2: The coach would bellow instructions from the sidelines.
meanings.sent3: She would bellow at the top of her lungs to scare away the birds.
meanings.sent4: The angry man would bellow his complaints to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent5: The sergeant would bellow orders to the troops during training.

meanings.sent1: The bellow of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent2: The bellow of the foghorn guided ships safely through the night.
meanings.sent3: The bellow of the old car engine signaled trouble ahead.
meanings.sent4: The bellow of the whale resonated through the ocean depths.
meanings.sent5: The bellow of the wind in the canyon created an eerie atmosphere.
